action.primary: Clears Heat, nourishes Yin, relieves cough and resolves Phlegm

indications: Fever due to Yin Deficiency Heat, pulmonary tuberculosis, cough, low back and knee soreness, weakness and pain. dizziness, tinnitus, sores and boils, red eyes, hemoptysis

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Spleen and Stomach Deficiency Cold.

notes: This herb has been shown to inhibit the growth of cancer cells.
In folk medicine, this herb is used to stop hematemesis.
The juice from the roots is squeezed out and used as a gargle for toothache.
One source says that this herb is good for purging pathogenic Fire and reducing fever and is used to treat fever, vexation, diarrhea and acute conjunctivitis in epidemic febrile diseases.
Take 9g of this herb daily for toothache. Double the dose if the condition is severe.

One source says that this herb is a Yin tonic which is cool in nature and is indicated for afternoon fever, hectic fever due to Yin Deficiency, low back and knee weakness and pain, dizziness and tinnitus.
